creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: depicts women’s customs in early 18th century Japan; from imperial and samurai women to courtesans and women of the merchant and peasant class; each shown in a group scene at their various occupations including reading, sewing, making fans, spinning, and farming
inscription:
Date, Inscription, and, Mark, and Seals

at end: [Wife of rich and virtuous; essence of Jusshukō incense; wife of mid-level merchant; female servant Dai...]
markings: marks on title label, in pen: [No 1538 / Sukenobu]; seals on first image: (2 unidentified); collectors seals first image: [Sekine Shisei]; [Sir Ernest M Satow]
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink on paper
signed: Signed at end: [Yamato Eshi Nishikawa Sukenobu zu]; colophon is dated Kyoho 14 [1729]
title: Women's Work and Manners
